trial_identification.studytitle: A Single-Dose Safety and Tolerability Placebo Controlled Study of Subcutaneous SCH 900222 in Healthy Volunteers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Single-Dose Safety and Tolerability Placebo Controlled Study of Subcutaneous SCH 900222 in Healthy Volunteers

conditions.healthcondition: The use of SCH 900222 for autoimmune disorders.

interventions.interventions: A single dose of either 50mg or 200mg SCH 900222 administered as a subcutaneous single injection.
interventions.comparator: Subcutaneous single injection of placebo (saline solution).

primaryOutcome.outcome: To determine the safety and tolerability of a rising single subcutaneous fixed dose of SCH 900222 in healthy subjects. (Assessed via vital sign measurements, standard laboratory safety tests, urinalysis &/or physical examinations)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed throughout the study at each study visit between Days 1-140 (13 visits).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To determine the relative bioavailability and pharmacokinetics of rising subcutaneous dose of SCH 900222 compared to parallel intravenous dosing in healthy subjects. (Assessed via pharmacokinetic (PK) blood sample analysis)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed throughout the study at each study visit between Days 1-140 (13 visits).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: -Male/Female Healthy volunteers must have no history of latent or active tuberculosis (TB) prior to screening
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of malignancy, Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, active or latent mycobacterium tuberculosis

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 2000 Galloping Hill Road Kenilworth, New Jersey 07033 USA

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 2000 Galloping Hill Road Kenilworth, New Jersey 07033 USA

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study will evaluate the safety, tolerability, & pharmacokinetic response to SCH 900222 subcutaneous fixed dose in healthy subjects.
